text.style: -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: start; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 25px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer; fill-opacity: 1;

-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: start; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 15px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;
text.tspan: Consider the functions defined by f(x) = |x |+ 2 and g(x) = |x | - 4 These functions are related to

text.style: -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: start; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 15px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;

-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: start; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 15px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;
text.tspan: The graph of f is the graph of x shifted upward by 2 units, as shown in the figure below

text.style: -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: start; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 15px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;

-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: start; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 15px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;

-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: start; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 15px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;
text.tspan: Similarly The graph of g is shifted downward by 4 units,

text.style: -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: start; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 15px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;

-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: start; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 15px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;

-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: start; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 15px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;
text.tspan: • The graph of h(x) + c is the graph of h(x) shifted upward by c units.

text.style: -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: start; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 15px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;
text.tspan: • The graph of h(x) - c is the graph of h(x) shifted downward by c units.

text.style: -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: start; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 15px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;
text.tspan: In general, for any function h(x) and any positive number c, the following are true.

text.style: -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: start; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 15px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;
